mods.abstract: $250 Reward. STOLEN from the subscriber, at his plantation, on Bayou DeSiard, in Ouachita parish, on the night of the 17th February, 1859, on Negro Man, named Anderson, aged about 22 years, of black complexion, about 6 feet 1 inch high, weighing about 160 lbs., having a pair of black pants and a black long hair coat on. Also, two Mules, one a bright sorrel, with a white nose; the other a dark sorrel, with dark legs up to the knee. The above are supposed to have been stolen by a white man, named Clinton DeWitt, aged about 22 years, about 5 feet 4 or 5 inches high, dark complexion, stoutly built, dark eyes and hair, no beard when he left; had on a brown jeans coat, a pair of dark kersey pants, and a broad rim leghorn straw hat; supposed to have goen westward from Monroe. I shall pay $250 for the thief and property, with evidence to convict him; or $150 for the slave and mules, or $100 for the slave alone. ROBERT L. WHYTE. Monroe, March 16, 1859-3t
